name: FortifyReport
description: Fetches and displays Fortify vulnerability reports from SSC or on Demand in Azure DevOps build results
author: Santhosh Kumar

inputs.name: sscUrl
inputs.label: Fortify SSC URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: The URL of your Fortify SSC instance (e.g., https://your-ssc-instance.com)

inputs.name: ciToken
inputs.label: CI Token
inputs.helpMarkDown: Your Fortify SSC CI token for authentication. **Tip:** Store this in a secure variable or Azure Key Vault for security.

inputs.name: fodUrl
inputs.label: Fortify on Demand API URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: The URL of your Fortify on Demand API instance. Select from common regions or enter a custom URL.

inputs.name: fodApiKey
inputs.label: API Key
inputs.helpMarkDown: Your Fortify on Demand API key for authentication. **Tip:** Store this in a secure variable or Azure Key Vault for security.

inputs.name: fodApiSecret
inputs.label: API Secret
inputs.helpMarkDown: Your Fortify on Demand API secret for authentication. **Tip:** Store this in a secure variable or Azure Key Vault for security.

inputs.name: appName
inputs.label: Application Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the application in Fortify. This must match exactly with the application name in your Fortify provider.

inputs.name: appVersion
inputs.label: Application Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Version/Release of the application in Fortify. This must match exactly with the version/release name in your Fortify provider.

inputs.name: maxIssues
inputs.label: Maximum Issues
inputs.helpMarkDown: Maximum number of issues to fetch from Fortify. Default is 10,000. Increase this value if your application has more issues than the default limit.

inputs.name: skipValidation
inputs.label: Skip Connection Validation
inputs.helpMarkDown: Skip validation of Fortify connection and application/version during task execution. Enable this if you're experiencing network issues or want faster execution.

messages.ReportConfigured: Fortify report configured successfully for %s v%s
